WorkItem.ClosedComment: The modeling for this was added a while ago
WorkItem.Description: I have never trusted rawr's trinket calculations. Nevertheless, I continue to try to get them working accurately so that other gear is calculated correctly. To get to the point, looking at item 37220, I can't figure out how to model the damage reduction for prot paladin. I tried making a special effect, but of course that didn't work. Any suggestions on modeling this item?

Comments.Message:
I used a % damage taken of -0.01% and it seemed to give it a decent value.

Ideally we should add a new variable for 'Damage Absorbed when Struck' and use that for Essence (as well as it's iLevel 245 version).
30 block doesnt nearly do it justice. i guess we really need a new effect like Jothay suggested

Uh, what?

Anyways, the proc really isn't that great.  It REALLY isn't.  You're picking up this trink for the passive Stam, not the awesome proc.  There's not really a whole lot of "justice" to be had in its name.

Having said that, I agree that setting up a new variable would be excellent.  It seems to be pretty easy to implement, too: Take the final damage of the hit taken, and reduce it by the value of the proc.  Shazam.
